title: SERGE CHALOFF     (1946-1956)     MOSAIC
description:
Serge Chaloff (1923-1957)  played bari-sax in a nearly "bird-like" manner.

Like bird, he died young from heroin use. His masterpiece: BLUE SERGE LP(Disc IV).



I've condensed Discs I and II master takes onto a single 80 minute CDR for your

burrrning convenience.  Use "CDBurnerXP" drag and drop if burrrn ever fails you.



Full MOSAIC booklet included however it's the same low quality you may have

come to expect here.  I have prioritized listening pleasure over analysis.



This music will delight even half-hearted fans of bebop.



Proceed directly to Disc III: BODY AND SOUL (trk #5)  to get an idea of Serge's

genius on bari-sax.




HAPPY SHORT DAYS TO ALL!  (northern hemisphere only)   HAPPY LONG DAYS ELSEWHERE!
